column1: My husbands backpack was stolen from the overhead rack above him on a train from Budapest to Vienna. Beware travelers! I think I know who they were as they passed by once, then came through again and sat behind us for a while. Happens anywhere but they seem like they do it regularly.

It's epidemic in France, and I gather a serious problem throughout Europe, though among the hundreds of travelers I have spoken with who have done this particular route this is the first instance I've heard of ... but others likely have more experience than I
We must beware not only on trains,buses, but everywhere in every countries ... Enen in my own Island Malta we have to beware
Yes, I think this is something that needs to be considered as a medium/high risk virtually anywhere in Europe these days, unfortunately.

EU must make a law be added in all EU countries that say that those to be found Guilty of such crimes on Turists even if its regards the first time offenders ,the minumum sentence must be 5 years in prison ... EU must make sure to safegourd the Turists Industry.... EU must stop the suspended sentences on such crimesEdited: 4 years ago
Some people say they should be executed. Why stop at 5 years?
at least this may scare some of these buggers

Had a similar problem last year in Salzburg waiting for Ljubljana train. Took the backpacks off on the platform and we were early & alone. A swarm of gypsy teenagers were all over the place in minutes - probably could smell a naive Texan from a mile. Keep a swivel head soldier is the advice I have
You can get lightweight retractable padlocks (pacsafe do some) to secure bags to the rack which will deter a sneak thief who won't want to use tools or a knife in full view to nick your luggage!
